translated: 5Here is the corrected and aligned text:ğŸ”½MahÄprajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ-sÅ«tra, Scroll 74
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 19, Section 5: Contemplation of Practice, Part One
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti,
Why do you say that form and so forth are included in the number of non-dual and non-erroneous dharmas?
SubhÅ«ti replied,
ÅšÄriputra!

Form is no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from form, form is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely form;

Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:
Form is included in the number of non-dual and non-erroneous dharmas, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are included in the number of non-dual and non-erroneous dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The eye-base is no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the eye-base, the eye-base is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the eye-base;

The ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-bases are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-bases, the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-bases are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-bases.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The eye-base enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-bases enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The form-base is no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the form-base, the form-base is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the form-base;

the sense fields of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the sense fields of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas, the sense fields of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the sense fields of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

the sense field of the form aggregate enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, the sense fields of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma aggregates enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The eye element is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the eye element, the eye element is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the eye element;

the form realm, the eye-consciousness realm, and eye-contact, and the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the form realm up to the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition, the form realm up to the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the form realm up to the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The eye realm enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, and the form realm up to the feelings produced by eye-contact as a condition enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The ear realm is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the ear realm, the ear realm is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the ear realm;

the sound element, ear consciousness element, and ear contact, as well as the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition, are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the sound element up to the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition. The sound element up to the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the sound element up to the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The ear element enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, and the sound element up to the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The nose element is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the nose element. The nose element is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the nose element;

the olfactory sphere, olfactory consciousness, olfactory contact, and the feelings that arise from olfactory contact as a condition are not different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are not different from the olfactory sphere up to the feelings that arise from olfactory contact as a condition. The olfactory sphere up to the feelings that arise from olfactory contact as a condition are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the olfactory sphere up to the feelings that arise from olfactory contact as a condition.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The olfactory sphere enters the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, and the olfactory sphere up to the feelings that arise from olfactory contact as a condition enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The gustatory sphere is not different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are not different from the gustatory sphere. The gustatory sphere is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the gustatory sphere;

the tongue element, the taste element, the tongue consciousness element, and the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the tongue are not different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are not different from the tongue element, taste element, tongue consciousness element, and the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the tongue. The tongue element, taste element, tongue consciousness element, and the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the tongue are themselves non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are themselves the tongue element, taste element, tongue consciousness element, and the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the tongue.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The tongue element enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, and the taste element, up to the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the tongue enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The body element is not different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are not different from the body element. The body element is itself non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are themselves the body element;

the sphere of touch, the body consciousness, bodily contact, and the feelings produced by bodily contact as a condition are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the sphere of touch up to the feelings produced by bodily contact as a condition. The sphere of touch up to the feelings produced by bodily contact as a condition are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the sphere of touch up to the feelings produced by bodily contact as a condition.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The sphere of the body enters the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, and the sphere of touch up to the feelings produced by bodily contact as a condition enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The sphere of the mind is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the sphere of the mind. The sphere of the mind is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the sphere of the mind;

the dharma realm, the mind consciousness realm, and the mind contact, the mind contact that gives rise to feelings produced from conditions are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the dharma realm up to the mind contact that gives rise to feelings produced from conditions, the dharma realm up to the mind contact that gives rise to feelings produced from conditions is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation is precisely the dharma realm up to the mind contact that gives rise to feelings produced from conditions.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The mind realm enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, the dharma realm up to the mind contact that gives rise to feelings produced from conditions enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The earth element is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the earth element, the earth element is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation is precisely the earth element;

the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
the earth element enters the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The noble truth of suffering is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of suffering is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the noble truth of suffering;

The noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path, the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The noble truth of suffering enters the category of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and the path enter the category of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

Ignorance is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from ignorance, ignorance is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely ignorance;

The non-differentiation of action, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief and distress and non-arising and non-cessation, the non-differentiation of non-arising and non-cessation and action up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief and distress, action up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief and distress are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely action up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief and distress.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
Ignorance enters the number of non-dual and non-false dharmas, and action up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief and distress enter the number of non-dual and non-false dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The non-differentiation of internal emptiness and non-arising and non-cessation, the non-differentiation of non-arising and non-cessation and internal emptiness, internal emptiness is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely internal emptiness;

external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are non-different from non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are non-different from external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence. External emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation is precisely external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:

Internal emptiness enters the category of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, and external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence enter the category of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The perfection of giving is no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the perfection of giving. The perfection of giving is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the perfection of giving.

The perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom. The perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, I say:

The perfection of giving enters the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, and the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The four meditations are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the four meditations. The four meditations are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the four meditations;

The four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations. The four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The four meditations enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, and the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The eight liberations are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the eight liberations. The eight liberations are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the eight liberations.

The eight [spheres of] mastery, nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and ten universal [bases of] totality are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the eight [spheres of] mastery, nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and ten universal [bases of] totality. The eight [spheres of] mastery, nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and ten universal [bases of] totality are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the eight [spheres of] mastery, nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and ten universal [bases of] totality.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The eight liberations enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, and the eight [spheres of] mastery, nine sequential [attainments of] concentration, and ten universal [bases of] totality enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The four establishments of mindfulness are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the four establishments of mindfulness. The four establishments of mindfulness are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the four establishments of mindfulness.

the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path, the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The four establishments of mindfulness enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas, the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path enter the number of non-dual and non-mistaken dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The emptiness liberation gate is not different from non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the emptiness liberation gate, the emptiness liberation gate is precisely non-arising and non-cessation, non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the emptiness liberation gate;

The doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness. The doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The door of liberation of emptiness enters the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, and the doors of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The five eyes are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the five eyes. The five eyes are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the five eyes;

The six supernormal powers are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the six supernormal powers. The six supernormal powers are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the six supernormal powers.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The five eyes enter the non-dual, non-erroneous Dharma-realm, and the six supernormal powers enter the non-dual, non-erroneous Dharma-realm.
ÅšÄriputra!

The ten powers of the Buddha are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the ten powers of the Buddha. The ten powers of the Buddha are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the ten powers of the Buddha;

The four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha are not different from non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are not different from the four fearlessnesses up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha. The four fearlessnesses up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha are precisely non-arising and non-cessation, and non-arising and non-cessation are precisely the four fearlessnesses up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

The ten powers of the Buddha enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, the four fearlessnesses up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

True suchness is not different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are not different from true suchness, true suchness is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely true suchness;

The dharma realm, dharma nature, equality nature, detachment nature, dharma determination, dharma abiding, ultimate reality, space realm, and inconceivable realm are not different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are not different from the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm, the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
True suchness enters the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, the dharma realm up to the inconceivable realm enters the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

Unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. Unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is itself non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are themselves unsurpassed perfect enlightenment;

All-knowledge, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from all-knowledge, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects. All-knowledge, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects are themselves non-arising and non-ceasing, and non-arising and non-ceasing are themselves all-knowledge, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:

Unsurpassed perfect enlightenment enters the category of non-dual and non-erroneous dharmas, and all-knowledge, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects enter the category of non-dual and non-erroneous dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

The dharma of non-forgetfulness is no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the dharma of non-forgetfulness, the dharma of non-forgetfulness is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the dharma of non-forgetfulness;

The nature of constant abiding and relinquishment is no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from the nature of constant abiding and relinquishment, the nature of constant abiding and relinquishment is precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely the nature of constant abiding and relinquishment.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
The dharma of non-forgetfulness enters the number of non-dual and non-erroneous dharmas, the nature of constant abiding and relinquishment enters the number of non-dual and non-erroneous dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!

All dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways are no different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are no different from all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways;

all doors of concentration are non-different from non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are non-different from all doors of concentration, all doors of concentration are precisely non-arising and non-ceasing, non-arising and non-ceasing are precisely all doors of concentration.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas, all doors of concentration enter the number of non-dual and non-deluded dharmas.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the non-arising of the self, because of ultimate purity;

they see the non-arising of sentient beings, life, one who is born, one who is nourished, a person, a pudgala, mind-born, a young boy, one who acts, one who experiences, one who knows, and one who sees, because of ultimate purity.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see form as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;
they see feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the eye sense base as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;
they see the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the form sense base as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;
they see the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the eye element as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;
seeing the form realm, eye consciousness realm, and eye contact, and the feelings produced with eye contact as their condition, as unborn, because of ultimate purity.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the ear realm as unborn, because of ultimate purity;
they see the sound realm, ear consciousness realm, and ear contact, and the feelings produced with ear contact as their condition, as unborn, because of ultimate purity.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the nose realm as unborn, because of ultimate purity;
they see the smell realm, nose consciousness realm, and nose contact, and the feelings produced with nose contact as their condition, as unborn, because of ultimate purity.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the tongue realm as unborn, because of ultimate purity;
seeing the realm of taste, the tongue consciousness, and the tongue contact and the feelings produced from the condition of tongue contact as non-arising, because of ultimate purity.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the body element as non-arising, because of ultimate purity;
they see the touch element, the body consciousness, and the body contact and the feelings produced from the condition of body contact as non-arising, because of ultimate purity.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the mind element as non-arising, because of ultimate purity;
they see the dharma element, the mind consciousness, and the mind contact and the feelings produced from the condition of mind contact as non-arising, because of ultimate purity.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the earth element as non-arising, because of ultimate purity;
Seeing the elements of water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the noble truth of suffering as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;
They see the noble truths of the accumulation [of suffering], cessation [of suffering], and the path [to the cessation of suffering] as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see ignorance as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;

They see the formative forces, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, dejection, and mental anguish as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see internal emptiness as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;

seeing external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the non-arising of the perfection of giving, because it is ultimately pure;
they see the non-arising of the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, because they are ultimately pure.
World-Honored One!

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the emptiness liberation gate as unborn, because of ultimate purity;

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the five eyes as unborn, because they are ultimately pure;

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the ten powers of the Buddha as unborn, because they are ultimately pure;

they see the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see omniscience as unborn, because it is ultimately pure;
they see the cognition of the path's characteristics and the cognition of all aspects as unborn, because they are ultimately pure.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see that the power of non-forgetfulness is unborn, because it is ultimately pure;

they see that all samÄdhi gateways are unborn, because they are ultimately pure.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see that ordinary beings are unborn, because they are ultimately pure;
they see that the dharmas of ordinary beings are unborn, because they are ultimately pure.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and contemplate dharmas, they see the non-arising of tathÄgatas, because it is ultimately pure;

At that time, ÅšÄriputra said to SubhÅ«ti,

According to the meaning I understand from what you have said, the non-arising of self, sentient beings, and so forth, the non-arising of form, feeling, and so forth, up to the non-arising of tathÄgatas and tathÄgata dharmas,

If that were so, there would be no difference in the rebirth of beings in the six destinies, and stream-enterers would not attain the fruit of stream-entry, once-returners would not attain the fruit of once-returning, non-returners would not attain the fruit of non-returning, arhats would not attain arhatship, pratyekabuddhas would not attain pratyekabuddhahood, and bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas would not attain omniscience, nor would they attain the five kinds of enlightenment.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
If all dharmas are definitely unborn, then why would stream-enterers cultivate the path to eliminate the three fetters for the fruit of stream-entry?
Why would once-returners cultivate the path to reduce greed, hatred, and delusion for the fruit of once-returning?
Why would non-returners cultivate the path to eliminate the five lower fetters for the fruit of non-returning?
Why would arhats cultivate the path to eliminate the five higher fetters for the fruit of arhatship?
Why would pratyekabuddhas cultivate the path to realize dependent origination for pratyekabuddhahood?

Why, for the sake of liberating innumerable sentient beings, do Bodhisattva-MahÄsattvas cultivate hundreds of thousands of difficult and painful practices, enduring boundless and various intense sufferings?
Why did the TathÄgata attain supreme perfect enlightenment?
Why do the Buddhas turn the wheel of the sublime Dharma for the sake of sentient beings?
At that time, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti replied to ÅšÄriputra, saying:

I do not see in the unborn dharmas any distinctions in the six destinies of rebirth, I do not see in the unborn dharmas anyone who can enter into the realization of the truths, I do not see in the unborn dharmas any stream-enterer attaining the fruit of stream-entry, any once-returner attaining the fruit of once-returning, any non-returner attaining the fruit of non-returning, or any arhat attaining arhatship, I do not see in the unborn dharmas any pratyekabuddha attaining pratyekabuddha enlightenment, and I do not see in the unborn dharmas any Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva attaining omniscience and the five kinds of enlightenment.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
I do not see in the unborn dharmas a stream-enterer who cultivates the path to eliminate the three bonds for the fruit of stream-entry;

I do not see in the unborn dharmas a once-returner who cultivates the path to thin out greed, hatred, and delusion for the fruit of once-returning;ğŸ”½I do not see in the unborn dharmas a non-returner who cultivates the path to eliminate the five lower bonds for the fruit of non-returning;
I do not see in the unborn dharmas an arhat who cultivates the path to eliminate the five higher bonds for the fruit of arhatship.
I do not see in the unborn dharmas a pratyekabuddha who cultivates the path of realizing dependent origination for pratyekabuddha enlightenment.

I do not see in the unborn dharmas a bodhisattva mahÄsattva who, for the sake of liberating innumerable sentient beings, cultivates hundreds of thousands of difficult and painful practices, enduring boundless and various intense sufferings, while the bodhisattva mahÄsattvas also do not give rise to the notion of difficult and painful practices.
Why is it so?
It is not possible to benefit immeasurable, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings by the thought of dwelling in difficult and austere practices.
ÅšÄriputra!

However, all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, using non-apprehension as a skillful means, give rise to a mind of great compassion towards all sentient beings, dwelling in the thought of them as parents, siblings, spouses, and themselves. In this way, they are able to greatly benefit immeasurable, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings.
ÅšÄriputra!
All bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should give rise to this thought:

'Just as my self-nature, in all dharmas, is sought in all ways, in all places, and at all times but cannot be apprehended, so it is with internal and external dharmas, which are all non-existent and unobtainable.'
Why is it so?
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas dwell in this thought and cultivate difficult and austere practices, they will then be able to benefit immeasurable, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings.
Therefore, bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should be without grasping at all dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!
I do not see any buddhas who, in the Dharma of non-arising, have realized supreme perfect enlightenment, turned the wheel of the sublime Dharma, and liberated innumerable sentient beings.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
Do you now wish to use the Dharma of arising to realize the Dharma of arising, or do you wish to use the Dharma of non-arising to realize the Dharma of non-arising?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
I truly do not wish to use the Dharma of arising to realize the Dharma of arising, nor do I truly wish to use the Dharma of non-arising to realize the Dharma of non-arising.
ÅšÄriputra said:
If that is so, do you now wish to use the Dharma of arising to realize the Dharma of non-arising, or do you wish to use the Dharma of non-arising to realize the Dharma of arising?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
I also do not wish to use the Dharma of arising to realize the Dharma of non-arising, nor do I wish to use the Dharma of non-arising to realize the Dharma of arising.
ÅšÄriputra said:
If it is so, then is there absolutely no attainment and no realization?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
Although there is attainment and realization, one does not attain through these two dharmas.
ÅšÄriputra!
It is only in worldly conventions that attainment and realization are established, but in the ultimate truth there is no attainment or realization.

It is only in worldly conventions that the stream-enterer, the fruit of stream-entry, the once-returner, the fruit of once-returning, the non-returner, the fruit of non-returning, the arhat, the fruit of arhatship, the pratyekabuddha, the pratyekabuddha's enlightenment, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and unsurpassed perfect enlightenment are established, but in the ultimate truth there are no stream-enterers up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
ÅšÄriputra said:

If attainment, realization, etc. exist only as conventionally designated by worldly speech and not ultimately, then the distinctions of the six destinies also exist only as conventionally designated by worldly speech, not ultimately, is that so?
SubhÅ«ti replied:ğŸ”½It is so!
It is so!
It is just as you have said.
Why is it so?
ÅšÄriputra!
Because in the ultimate truth there is no karma, no ripening, no arising, no ceasing, no defilement, and no purification.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti:
Do you now wish to cause unarisen dharmas to arise, or do you wish to cause already arisen dharmas to arise?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
I do not wish to cause unarisen dharmas to arise, nor do I wish to cause already arisen dharmas to arise.
ÅšÄriputra said:
What are those unarisen dharmas that you do not wish to cause to arise?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
ÅšÄriputra!
Form is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye sense base is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The form sense base is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
Sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye element is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
The form element, eye consciousness element, eye contact, and the feelings produced from eye contact as a condition are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The ear element is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
The sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings produced from ear contact as a condition are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The nose element is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
the olfactory sphere, olfactory consciousness, olfactory contact, and the feelings that arise from olfactory contact as a condition are unarisen dharmas, and I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The tongue sphere is an unarisen dharma, and I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of its emptiness of inherent nature.
The gustatory sphere, gustatory consciousness, gustatory contact, and the feelings that arise from gustatory contact as a condition are unarisen dharmas, and I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The bodily sphere is an unarisen dharma, and I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of its emptiness of inherent nature.
The tactile sphere, tactile consciousness, tactile contact, and the feelings that arise from tactile contact as a condition are unarisen dharmas, and I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The mind realm is a non-arising dharma, and I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
The dharma realm, mental consciousness realm, and the mental contact and the feelings produced by mental contact as a condition are non-arising dharmas, and I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The earth element is a non-arising dharma, and I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
The water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are non-arising dharmas, and I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The noble truth of suffering is a non-arising dharma, and I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of its own nature.
The noble truths of the origin, cessation, and path are non-arising dharmas, and I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of their own nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
Ignorance is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of its inherent emptiness.

Formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their inherent emptiness.
ÅšÄriputra!
Internal emptiness is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of its inherent emptiness.

external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.

ÅšÄriputra!
The perfection of generosity is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.
The perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The four meditations are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The four immeasurables and the four formless concentrations are unborn dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The eight liberations are unborn dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The eight superior [meditative] states, the nine successive [meditative] stages, and the ten universal bases are unborn dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The four establishments of mindfulness are unborn dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.

The four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path are unborn dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The emptiness of the liberation gate is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of its emptiness of inherent nature.
The signless and wishless liberation gates are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The five eyes are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their emptiness of inherent nature.
The six supernormal knowledges are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The ten powers of the Buddha are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of their emptiness of inherent nature.

The four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The knowledge of all modes is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The knowledge of all aspects is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The dharma of non-forgetfulness is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The nature of constant abandonment is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
All dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
All samÄdhi gateways are non-arising dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
Ordinary beings are a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The dharmas of ordinary beings are a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The stream-enterer is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The dharmas of the stream-enterer are a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The once-returner is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The dharmas of the once-returner are a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The non-returner is a non-arising dharma, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The dharma of non-returning is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The arhat is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The dharma of the arhat is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The pratyekabuddha is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The dharma of the pratyekabuddha is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The bodhisattva is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The Dharma of the bodhisattvas is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The TathÄgata is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause him to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The Dharma of the TathÄgata is a non-arising dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra said:
What are the already arisen dharmas that you do not wish to cause to arise?
SubhÅ«ti replied:
Form is an already arisen dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are already arisen dharmas. I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye sense base is an already arisen dharma. I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are already arisen dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The form sense base is an already arisen dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are already arisen dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye element is an already arisen dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
The form element, eye consciousness element, and eye contact, as well as the feelings that arise from eye contact as a condition, are already arisen dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The ear element is a produced dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of inherent nature.
The sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition are produced dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The nose element is a produced dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of inherent nature.
The smell element, nose consciousness element, nose contact, and the feelings that arise from nose contact as a condition are produced dharmas, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The tongue element is a produced dharma, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of inherent nature.
The realm of taste, the tongue consciousness, and the contact and sensations arising from tongue contact that have already arisen, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty by nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The body element is a dharma that has already arisen, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty by nature.
The realm of touch, the body consciousness, and the contact and sensations arising from body contact that have already arisen, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty by nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The mind element is a dharma that has already arisen, I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty by nature.
The realm of mental objects, the mind consciousness, and the contact and sensations arising from mind contact that have already arisen, I do not wish to cause them to arise.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty by nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The earth element is a produced dharma, but I do not wish for it to be produced.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of inherent nature.
The water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are produced dharmas, but I do not wish for them to be produced.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The noble truth of suffering is a produced dharma, but I do not wish for it to be produced.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of inherent nature.
The truths of the origin, cessation, and path are produced dharmas, but I do not wish for them to be produced.
Why is it so?
Because they are empty of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
Ignorance is a produced dharma, but I do not wish for it to be produced.
Why is it so?
Because it is empty of inherent nature.

The formative forces, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, dejection, and anguish are produced dharmas, but I do not wish for them to be produced.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.
ÅšÄriputra!
The emptiness of internal phenomena is a produced dharma, and I do not wish to cause it to arise.
Why is it so?
Because of the emptiness of inherent nature.

The emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of dispersion, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of inherent nature, and the emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence are produced dharmas, and I do not wish to cause them to arise.
